channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16377] ServerName check is ineffective in region_mover.rb
item.description:
The following was observed during test of region_mover.rb :


2016-08-08 11:17:05,341|beaver.machine|INFO|352|139926954637120|MainThread|2016-08-08 11:17:05,340 INFO  [RubyThread-9: hbase-client/bin/thread-pool.rb:28] region_mover: Moving region  hbase:meta,,1.1588230740 (1 of 14) from xyz.openstacklocal,16020,1470654716593, to server=xyz.openstacklocal,16020,1470654716593

There is check that target server should not be the same as current server:


    if currentServer and currentServer == servername

      $LOG.info("Region " + r.getRegionNameAsString() + " (" + counter.to_s +

        " of " + regions.length.to_s + ") already on target server=" + servername)

      counter = counter + 1

      next

    end

However, the check is not effective.
See comparison between object1 and object3:
http://www.skorks.com/2009/09/ruby-equality-and-object-comparison/
item.summary: ServerName check is ineffective in region_mover.rb

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

I think the final reason is host name is different is Meta table between web and zk!
see the HBASE-16222

The quoted log was redacted - there was no uppercase letter originally.
So I think the cause may not be HBASE-16222.

This message was automatically generated.

Ruby strings do == and eql? as value checks. Might it not be better to make sure getServerNameForRegion always returns a Ruby string? It seems like the meta region path might not (but I'm not sure how that works with JRuby), while the other branch of getServerNameForRegion does return a Ruby string:

Maybe make a change...


def getServerNameForRegion(admin, r)

  return nil unless admin.isTableEnabled(r.getTableName)

  if r.isMetaRegion()

    # Hack

    zkw = org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWatcher.new(admin.getConfiguration(), "region_mover", nil)

    mtl = org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.MetaTableLocator.new()

    begin

      while not mtl.isLocationAvailable(zkw)

        sleep 0.1

      end

      # Make a fake servername by appending ','

      metaServer = (mtl.getMetaRegionLocation(zkw).toString() + ",").to_s

      return metaServer

    ensure

      zkw.close()

    end

  end

I need to test this out some more, but the extra .to_s cal you added to currentServer seems unnecessary to me.

It appears that servername in this method is a ServerName so calling to_s on that object does make sense (as the ServerName instance of passed along to the move method).

Thanks for the review, Josh.

In order to narrow the scope of change (there is no sign that other part of the script works incorrectly), I think leaving the .to_s on currentServer is safer.

In order to narrow the scope of change (there is no sign that other part of the script works incorrectly), I think leaving the .to_s on currentServer is safer.

Might it not be better to make sure getServerNameForRegion always returns a Ruby string?

Is my assessment wrong (not sure if you have looked at this more closely than I have)? It seems like having getServerNameForRegion returning two different types of objects is more worrisome than unintended side-effects (since the method is local to this file, not a part of hbase-shell/src/main/ruby/hbase).

To my point, if getServerNameForRegion is in fact returning different types of values, def isSameServer would also potentially return incorrect values when using the meta region to locate a server. I would have to do some more playing around here to be certain.

Patch v2 addresses Josh's comment.

Tested the change on a secure cluster by moving regions onto specified server.

-1 overall
